Q: What is the significance of restarting the device after changing parameters?
A1: Restarting ensures that all changes are properly applied and the system is refreshed.
A2: A reboot allows the device to initialize with the new parameters, ensuring they take effect.
A3: It helps in clearing any temporary states or caches that might interfere with the new settings.
A4: Restarting is crucial for the system to recognize and implement parameter changes fully.
A5: This step verifies that the device operates correctly under the new parameters without residual effects from previous settings.
